clinical_study.brief_title: 3 Minutes Chair Rise Test (3CRT) in Patients With COPD
clinical_study.official_title: Chair Rise Tests for a Simplified Evaluation of Functional Response After a Rehabilitation Program in Patients COPD.

brief_summary.textblock:
Improvement in the functional functioning and dyspnea of COPD patients after a rehabilitation program (RHB) is assessed by exercise tests and questionnaires difficult to replicate outside specialized centers.
In order to monitor the eventual decline of patients in the course of their RHB management, Chair Rise Tests (3CRT-1CRT-5STS) and short questionnaires were developed (CAT-DIRECT). The goal of this prospective, multicenter, real-life study is to compare the change in several functional function tests and questionnaires of quality of life and dyspnea related to daily activities. In addition, MCIDs of the 3CRT and the DIRECT questionnaire (Disability Related to COPS Tool) were specified.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of number of rise during 3 minutes Chair Rise Test (3CRT)
primary_outcome.description: The change of total number of rise during a 3 minutes Chair Rise Test (3CRT) from baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of number of rise during 1 minute Chair Rise Test (1CRT)
secondary_outcome.description: The change of total number of rise during a 1 minutes Chair Rise Test (3CRT) from baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Time to perform 5 sit to stand
secondary_outcome.description: The change of Time to perform 5 sit to stand from baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: The change of Total score for the DIsability RElated to COPD Tool (DIRECT)
Difference in physiological response (SpO2 and HR) during the 3 Chair Rise Tests (3CRT-1CRT-5STS)
Change in endurance time at constant power on cyclo ergometer,
secondary_outcome.description: The change of endurance time from baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Voluntary Quadriceps force output
secondary_outcome.description: Change of Voluntary quadriceps force measurements (Mean of 3 maximal measurements) from baseline

arm_group.description: All convenient COPD patients admitted in real life for a rehabilitation program were included. Exercises consist on a Chair Rise Tests and short questionnaire were added to the usual tools for the evaluation.

intervention.intervention_name: Chair Rise Tests and short questionnaire
intervention.description: Exercises consist on a Chair Rise Tests and short questionnaire It is a functional test evaluating the number of chair rise over a given time and / or frequency. This test is combined with a questionnaire to collect quantitative and qualitative information: dyspnea and muscular fatigue at rest before the start of the test and at the end of the exercise Saturation at rest, and at the end of the exercise the number of total a chair rise

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient with COPD Gold II to IV
- Patient admitted for a rehabilitation program in real life
- Person affiliated to the Social Security or beneficiary of such a scheme
- Informed and written consent by patient or legal representative
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient limited by reduced locomotor activity or joint pain that compromises their participation in a rehabilitation program
- Patients with a performance less than 250 meters during 6MWT
- Non-stable cardiac disease
- Any other lung disease than COPD
- Person subject to a legal protection measure
